Posts.Content: bennymuffins wrote: Boy, I wonder how many people have started a thread with that title in this forum. Probably a few. Anyway, I am 54 years old and was just diagnosed this morning with BC. I've had two biopsies on breast and lymph nodes. They are removing all my lymph nodes on the right side so I am assuming it is advanced stage. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. Log in to post a reply

They are removing all my lymph nodes on the right side so I am assuming it is advanced stage. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. Log in to post a reply

They are removing all my lymph nodes on the right side so I am assuming it is advanced stage. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: In shock bennymuffins websister

Posts.Content: bennymuffins wrote: Just had surgery and I hurt. This blasted drain hose and bottle is driving me insane. And the incision aches, despite tylenol #3 every 4 hours. I can't wear a bra so am going around the house holding my poor old boob (M.P.O.B). The nurse navigator said no bra after surgery, but she is probably an A cup. I am just over a D and I literally am walking around my house holding MPOB up. No matter what I do, what I try, I can't get rid of the pain. I can't do anything because I only have one free hand (the other is holding up MPOB). Two weeks of this? I tried to sleep last night but no chance to get comfortable so lay there straight as a board so as not to upset the stupid hose. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. Log in to post a reply

I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive. I meet with the oncologist tomorrow for a list of tests I have to do (CAT scans, etc), then will find out what stage. This came totally out of the blue for me. I have always been healthy, been a vegetarian for 32 years of my 54 on the planet. I am in total shock, like a nightmare that I will awake from. I am alternating between shock and crying. Please take no offense to this, but this is not a forum I ever wanted to join. The counsellor has told me to 'stay neutral'; do not catastrophize my situation. Don't start thinking about death, but it's so hard not to. Sept 17 - Lumpectomy and 15 lymph nodes removed. Cancer in breast is 1.7 cm; 6/15 lymph nodes. Stage IIIa, grade 3, estrogen positive.
